item.title: Stardew Valley Fan Spots Cute Game Reference at Coffee Shop
item.description:
Summary

  • Stardew Valley fans may find references in unexpected places like coffee shops, showcasing the game's enduring charm.
  • Coffee shops often pay tribute to Stardew Valley through menu items, decorations, and signs, celebrating the game's influence.
  • The relaxing atmosphere of cafes seems to align well with the cozy and charming qualities of Stardew Valley, leading to continued nods.

A Stardew Valley player had a nice surprise when they discovered that a local coffee shop had made a cute reference to the game. Stardew Valley sometimes gets unexpected nods like this, likely due in part to the game's charming and soothing qualities.

Stardew Valley is extremely popular, especially for an indie game, making references like this more common. Fans of the game find ways to make tributes to it in the form of fanart, but some have even gone so far as to integrate it into their businesses in some small way.

Such was the case with one coffee shop, which Reddit user leftforread discovered for themselves. The coffee shop, which appears to be called Mojo, had a sign board advertising a drink available at the cafe. For fans of the game, the influence is immediately obvious. The title of the drink is written with nailed-together boards, like how the game's name is written on the title screen of Stardew Valley . A Stardew Valley -style character stands beneath the text, holding a cup of coffee over their head with a heart bubble floating above it. Lastly, with the drink being a maple-flavored drink, the signboard appropriately includes Maple Seeds.

Stardew Valley and Coffee Shops Go Hand-in-Hand

This is far from the first time that a Stardew Valley fan has been delighted to discover a coffee shop referencing the cozy life sim game. For example, one fan shared their surprise when they discovered that a local Starbucks location was acknowledging Stardew Valley . In that case, a chalkboard was celebrating the fall season, with iconography and characters from the game, like Abigail, Harvey, and multiple Junimos.

In another case, a local cafe was celebrating the game by not only creating a signboard with familiar sights from the game, but a beverage menu dedicated to the title. In that case, the cafe was celebrating Stardew Valley 's 1.6 update, with drinks based upon things like the Pink Cake, Stardrops, locales like Ginger Island, and even characters like Krobus.

Stardew Valley players often integrate coffee and espresso into the start of their in-game day to get a speed boost, but that's probably not the reason behind these cafe signs. While only those responsible for them could say for sure, it seems like the relaxing atmosphere of many cafes work well with the charming qualities of the game. In any case, it's likely that this won't be the last time that fans spot a clever nod to the game at a coffee shop.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Creates Mega Evolutions for Legends: Z-A Starters
item.description:
Summary

  • A fan artist shared Mega Evolution concepts for Feraligatr, Emboar, and Meganium, including new types and abilities.
  • Mega Evolution returns in Pokemon Legends: Z-A as the main battle mechanic.

A Pokemon Legends: Z-A fan artist took to social media to share their concepts of the Mega Evolution forms of Feraligatr, Emboar, and Meganium, the game's starter critters. The Pokemon Legends: Z-A fan artist also included new types and abilities to go with their conceptual Mega Evolution forms.

Initially introduced in Pokemon X and Y , Mega Evolution is a battle gimmick that allows certain Pokemon to transform temporarily into a Mega stage, which grants them a new appearance and occasionally changes their types and abilities. However, Mega Evolution requires a Pokemon to hold a matching keystone item, and the process can only happen once per battle. Mega Evolution was retired following the launch of Pokemon Sword and Shield , but it has returned as the main battle mechanic of Legends: Z-A . Since then, Pokemon fan artists have designed their own Mega Evolution concepts for Pokemon like Clefable which had not received one before.

Despite some leaks surrounding the Mega Evolution forms of Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's starters, a fan artist shared their take on what these new forms could look like. On the r/Pokemon subreddit, a Redditor named JJonnie shared their drawings of Mega Feraligatr, Emboar, and Meganium, along with their types and abilities. Starting with Mega Feraligatr, the Big Jaw Pokemon kept its Water typing but gained Poison as its secondary type. Mega Feraligatr's jaw and spines were colored purple, with glowing bands surrounding its arms and legs. Mega Feraligatr also gained a unique ability called Venom Eater, which would act like a Poison-type variant of similar abilities like Flash Fire.

Pokemon Fan Artist Draws Mega Feraligatr, Emboar, and Meganium Concepts

Mega Emboar, by contrast, lost its secondary Fighting type and was drawn as a pure Fire-type Pokemon. Mega Emboar was drawn as an egg-shaped bomb, with fire radiating from its body. Mega Emboar's Super Aftermath ability would allow it to use Explosion upon fainting. Although some Pokemon Legends: Z-A leaks stated that Mega Meganium would be a Grass and Fairy dual-type, JJonnie chose a different approach for the Herb Pokemon. JJonnie's Mega Meganium concept was designed as a Grass and Dragon type, with spiked petals across its eyes, neck, and tail. Mega Meganium's City Wrecker ability would allow it to deal serious damage to Steel Pokemon like Excadrill and Metagross. Pokemon fans thanked JJonnie for their contributions, and some praised the Mega Emboar design for its uniqueness.

Between the return of Mega Evolutions and a Nintendo Switch 2 Edition, Pokemon Legends: Z-A is one of the most anticipated games of 2025. What Pokemon fans will create next remains to be seen.

item.title: The Sims 4: Pregnancy Cheat Codes
item.description:
One of the most important phase of a Sims life in The Sims 4 is when they're pregnant, as raising a new generation is a key part of the game. Another crucial aspect of The Sims 4 is cheating; unlike most games, in The Sims 4 it's simply a way for players to enhance their gaming experience.

Just like any part of The Sims 4 , players can cheat their way through pregnancy to speed up the process and even modify how many babies they will give birth to. This article lists the few pregnancy cheats available in The Sims 4 . However, to activate them, players will have to install the All Cheats Fix mod, as pregnancy cheat codes no longer work in-game. Consequently, this also means that the codes mentioned on this list will not work on console and requires players to have this mod.

To activate cheats, players mustn't forget to open the cheat console and input the code "testingcheats on".

Updated on April 15, 2025, by Ashely Claudino: This article has been completely rewritten and turned into a list to improve fans' reading experience. It features a concise list of all the pregnancy cheats that become available in The Sims 4 once players install the All Cheats Fix mod and information on the MC Command Center mod, which gives them access to a vast array of customize settings and allows gamers to dictate pretty much any aspect of their Sims' pregnancies.

Cheat to Change Pregnancy Stage

Pick Any of the Three Trimesters

Sims will enter three trimesters while pregnant in The Sims 4 . Each of these trimesters lasts a day, and since it can get boring waiting around, players might want to speed things up a little. Whether they want to skip to the part where they get leave from work or simply move it along a bit, there's no harm with getting to a more advanced trimester faster.

To change a Sim's trimester in The Sims 4 , gamers must open the cheat console and input the code " sims.add_buff buff_Pregnancy_Trimester[#] " and replace the # with the number 1, 2, or 3.

Cheat to Go Into Labor

Skip the Waiting Part and Go Straight to the Good Stuff

If players want to skip to the very end of a pregnancy in The Sims 4 , they can also induce a Sim's labor with cheats. To force a Sim to go into labor, players must open the cheat console and input this code: " sims.add_buff buff_Pregnancy_InLabor ".

Players must be aware that forcing labor will make it so the Sim will give birth within the next few hours. They can then take them to the hospital or have the baby at home. Nevertheless, Sims will have a newborn in their arms in no time.

Cheat For Twins or Triplets in The Sims 4

Two Newborns Are Better Than One, Even Three

Whether players are doing the 100 Baby Challenge or simply want to have twins or triplets for chaotics or a more exciting storyline, they'll be happy to know that there is a cheat that lets them do it having to put too much effort into it or relying on luck.

Firstly, players have to find out their pregnant Sim's ID, which they can do by typing the code " sims.get_sim_id_by_name [FirstName] [LastName] " into the cheat console, using their pregnant Sim's information. Lastly, they need to use the " codepregnancy.force_offspring_count [Sim ID] [# of offspring] " activate the code.

MC Command Center

The Ultimate Way to Activate Pregnancy Cheats

MC Command Center is one of the most popular mods for The Sims 4 , and it adds a wide range of customization to the game. This mod includes two options that are particularly important for Simmers that want to modify their Sim's pregnancies as much as possible, and that's MC Pregnancy and MC Woohoo.

If players install MC Command Center and MC Woohoo, they will be able to customize all sorts of pregnancy-related settings by accessing any computer in the game and selecting the "MC Command Center" option. Here, gamers will be able to access all sorts of cheats by visiting the MC Pregnancy tab.

item.title: Pokemon GO Details Might and Mastery Battle League Update
item.description:
Summary

  • Niantic reveals an update on Pokemon GO Might and Mastery Battle League, including restrictions for Spring Cup: Great League Edition.
  • Great League Remix has updated restrictions for CP and eligible Pokemon types, with 20 Pokemon not being able to participate.
  • Players can earn rewards and guaranteed encounters with select Pokemon by participating in Battle League and completing Timed Research.

Niantic revealed an update for the Pokemon GO Might and Mastery Battle League along with updated restrictions for Great League Remix. During the Master League, Pokemon GO players can earn rewards and climb up the ranks while facing other players.

The Pokemon GO Might and Mastery season began on March 4 and coincided with the start of Battle League, and it will last until the end of the season on June 3. The Battle League puts the best trainers in the world against each other with certain restrictions placed on CP, and choosing the right team is crucial for players wanting to perform well against expert opponents. Every week, a tier of the Battle League becomes available, and players can earn additional rewards by participating in Cups, such as the Spring Cup: Great League Edition.

Niantic updated its schedule for Pokemon GO Might and Mastery Battle League for the week of April 15 through April 22 at 1:00 p.m. PST, confirming that Master League and Spring Cup: Great League Edition are both active. Pokemon Trainers who compete in Master League and Spring Cup: Great League Edition will earn 4x Stardust with their win rewards, which doesn't include end-of-set rewards. However, there are some restrictions that Pokemon GO players should consider before finalizing their team. Firstly, Pokemon must have 1,500 CP or less to enter Spring Cup: Great League Edition, and only Water-, Grass-, and Fairy-type Pokemon are eligible to enter. In addition, Jumpluff, Roserade, and Toxapex aren't able to participate in the Cup either, according to Niantic's blog post.

Pokemon GO Reveals Update for Master League, Spring Cup: Great League Edition and Great League Remix

What's more, Niantic confirmed that Great League Remix will make its return in the week of April 29 through May 6. The CP restriction from Spring Cup: Great League Edition applies again, and the top 20 most used Pokemon by players ranked Ace and above from the Great League are ineligible for Great League Remix. These Pokemon include Blastoise, Wigglytuff, Marowak, Galarian Weezing, Lapras, Feraligatr, Azumarill, Jumpluff, Sableye, Cradily, Gastrodon, Drapion, Serperior, Mandibuzz, Talonflame, Malamar, Golisopod, Morpeko, Annihilape, and Clodsire.

As previously revealed earlier in the season, Pokemon GO players can earn guaranteed encounters with select Pokemon by reaching Ace, Veteran, Expert, and Legend ranks. During Might and Mastery, players can earn guaranteed encounters with Vullaby, Morpeko, Frigibax, Dreepy, Dreepy, and Pikachu Libre by rising up the ranks. There's also Battle League-themed Timed Research to obtain in the Pokemon GO in-game shop. The Timed Research will keep track of the player's Battle League victories throughout the season, and each research page requires 100 wins to complete. Stardust, Rare Candy XL, Elite Fast TM, and Elite Charged TM are some of the rewards that players can unlock by getting those important wins in the Might and Mastery Battle League.

This season's Pokemon GO Battle League will culminate with GO Battle Week: Might and Mastery, which lasts from May 21 at 12:00 a.m. to May 27 at 11:59 p.m. local time. The 4x Stardust bonus applies once more during GO Battle Week, and there will be free battle-themed Timed Research as well. One of the rewards includes an avatar hat inspired by Mustard. Before the season ends, players can expect several new Raid Day events in Pokemon GO as well.

item.title: 8 Best Video Game Soundtracks By Yoko Shimomura
item.description:
Summary

  • Yoko Shimomura revolutionized the gaming industry with her beautiful soundtracks, earning her a prestigious BAFTA award.
  • Shimomura's best works include Parasite Eve, Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story, and the entire Kingdom Hearts franchise.
  • Her diverse range as a composer is shown in iconic works like Street Fighter 2, Super Mario RPG, and Final Fantasy 15.

The video game industry is filled with countless talented musicians that have created some of the best soundtracks ever made, and Yoko Shimomura is one of them. Since the late 1980s, this legendary Japanese composer has been revolutionizing the industry with her beautiful compositions. It’s no surprise that she recently received a BAFTA award for her prestigious career.

Unbeknownst to most gamers, Shimomura has been responsible for some of the most iconic and influential music tracks in all gaming, which leaves one big question: What has been her best video game soundtrack so far? Of course, music is always a team effort, and she has made many soundtracks alongside other talented composers. However, this list will only take into account video games in which Yoko Shimomura is credited as the sole composer.

8 Parasite Eve

A Dark Horror Game With A Creepy, Atmospheric OST

Your comment has not been saved

Parasite Eve
9.7 /10
Released
September 9, 1998

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Animated Violence, Mature Sexual Themes
Powered by

Parasite Eve , an adaptation/sequel of Hideaki Sena’s novel of the same, is an RPG by Squaresoft from 1998. This title has always stood out from the company’s usual repertoire, because its atmosphere and third-person gameplay make it look and feel similar to a horror game. Square chose none other than Yoko Shimomura herself to create the background music for this creepy adventure.

Parasite Eve is one of Shimomura’s most distinct works. It doesn’t feel as whimsical or cheerful as her usual soundtracks, and instead has a bigger focus on creating a dark and suspenseful atmosphere, with the occasional fast-paced track for the action segments. Some of the best songs in this collection include "Out of Phase" and "Wheel Of Fortune." Sadly , Shimomura didn’t return to compose the music for Parasite Eve 2.

7 Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story

A Bouncy, Catchy OST For A Colorful RPG

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story
9.5 /10
Released
September 15, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to Comic Mischief, Mild Cartoon Violence
Powered by

Yoko Shimomura was the sole composer of all the entries in the Mario & Luigi RPG series (with the only exception being 2024’s Brothership ) and she did an excellent job with all of their soundtracks. But most fans agree that the music in Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story is some of her best work so far.

This is another wacky, colorful RPG starring the Mario brothers, so it makes sense that most of its background music fits that vibe perfectly. "They're Pretty Tough," "Should We Be Careful?" and "Fawful" are some of the catchiest ones on the soundtrack. But this game’s biggest standout is "In The Final," an epic final boss theme. Shimomura channeled her experience working in RPGs for over a decade, and it worked very well.

6 Kingdom Hearts 358/2 Days

A Heartwarming, Melancholic OST For The Nintendo DS

Your comment has not been saved

Kingdom Hearts 358/2 Days
Action RPG
Fighting
Action-Adventure
Systems
Released
May 30, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Yoko Shimomura is best known for her contributions to the legendary Kingdom Hearts franchise, where she composed entire soundtracks by herself. Kingdom Hearts 358/2 Days , an action RPG that tells the tragic story of Roxas, credits her as the sole composer, and she did a spectacular job with it.

Half of this soundtrack is made up of songs from other Kingdom Hearts games, but she successfully rearranged them with the DS’s sound font. But, of course, this melancholic story is also filled to the brim with new original songs that elevate all of its emotional moments, like "At Dusk," and "Musique pour la tristesse de Xion." The final boss theme, "Vector to the Heavens," is one of the best tracks Shimomura has ever created. She was able to remix most of these songs with the help of an orchestra for Kingdom Hearts 1.5 HD Remix , and they all sound even more beautiful.

5 Street Fighter 2

One Of The Most Legendary Fighting Game OSTs Ever Made

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Street Fighter 2
9 /10
Released
March 7, 1991

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Street Fighter 2 revolutionized the fighting game genre forever. Curiously, many fans are not aware that the game’s composer was Yoko Shimomura, who worked at Capcom until she left for Squaresoft a few years later. This means that this legendary composer is responsible for some of the most recognizable music ever made for a fighting video game.

Street Fighter 2 is known for two things: its roster of iconic playable fighters from different parts of the world, and its fast-paced combat system. Shimomura perfectly conveyed these two characteristics with a catchy soundtrack that features many individual themes representing the respective cultures of their characters. Ryu, Ken, Chun-Li, Guile, and many more owe their iconic themes to Yoko Shimomura.

4 Super Mario RPG: Legend Of The Seven Stars

One Of The Most Distinctive OSTs In The Mario Franchise

Your comment has not been saved

Super Mario RPG
8.7 /10
Released
November 17, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone Due To Mild Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Yoko Shimomura was most likely chosen to compose the music for the Mario & Luigi series because she was also responsible for the soundtrack of Super Mario RPG: Legend Of The Seven Stars , the very first RPG in the Mario franchise. After all, this was a joint venture between Squaresoft and Nintendo, so she was a perfect fit. Nevertheless, it was a monumental task, because she had to rearrange some classic Mario and Final Fantasy tunes by other composers (Koji Kondo and Nobuo Uematsu, respectively).

The soundtrack of Super Mario RPG is known for its vast collection of original songs. This game has a very specific sound that was like nothing else in the industry at the time. Some of its most memorable tracks include . Fortunately, Shimomura returned to compose the music for the 2024 remake of Super Mario RPG , which includes an option to choose between the new arrangements and the original music from the 1996 release.

3 Final Fantasy 15

One Of Shimomura’s Most Ambitious Projects

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 15
9 /10
8.2 /10
Released
November 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Language, Mild Blood, Partial Nudity, Violence
Powered by

Despite working for Squaresoft and Square Enix for so long, it took Yoko Shimomura twenty-eight years to make the music for a Final Fantasy game, as she was the main composer of 2016’s Final Fantasy 15 . This made a lot of sense, seeing as this project was originally directed by one of her most frequent collaborators, Tetsuya Nomura, and it shared a lot of similarities with Kingdom Hearts .

This open-world action RPG was in development for approximately ten years, so it obviously ended up becoming one of her most ambitious projects. With the help of a full-blown orchestra, Shimomura created a beautiful high-quality soundtrack that made Noctis’ journey all the more memorable, exciting, and tragic. The game featured a variety of excellent songs that fit each specific situation, like "Apocalypsis Noctis," "Valse Di Fantastica," "Somnus," and many more. It's a shame she didn't make more music for Final Fantasy titles, because FF15 's OST is one of the most incredible works of her career.

2 Kingdom Hearts

Cemented Her As One Of The Industry's Best Composers

Your comment has not been saved

Kingdom Hearts
9.4 /10
Released
September 17, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Violence
Powered by

In the early 2000s, Squaresoft and Disney joined forces to make Kingdom Hearts , a bizarre but innovative action RPG that featured levels based off of classic animated films. Yoko Shimomura was chosen as the composer, which must have been a tall task, seeing as she had to capture the essence of both Final Fantasy and Disney.

Needless to say, she did a fantastic job with this soundtrack. The game’s title theme, "Dearly Beloved," is so beautiful and iconic that that alone is enough to place her in the “Video Game Composer Hall of Fame.” Yet, it was only the beginning, since Kingdom Hearts is full of incredible original music. The background music of the worlds is always catchy, while the combat music makes each encounter more thrilling. While the original PS2 iterations of these songs were already great, she remastered them with an orchestra for Kingdom Hearts 1.5 HD Remix , where they sounded even better.

1 Kingdom Hearts 2

An Excellent Sequel With One Of The Best Video Game OSTs Ever Made

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Kingdom Hearts 2
Action RPG
Hack and Slash
Systems
Released
March 28, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Mild Blood, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

Two years after the release of Kingdom Hearts , Square and Disney launched Kingdom Hearts 2 , and Yoko Shimomura was chosen once again as the game’s composer. Everything about this game was bigger and better than its predecessor: the combat, the bosses, the story. Thus, its soundtrack needed to be on the same level. Shimomura not only did not disappoint, but she also ended up making one of the best soundtracks of her career.

The music of Kingdom Hearts 2 is extremely diverse. It features beautiful and tragic character themes, like "Roxas," as well as catchy and lighthearted background music for all of its Disney worlds, like "A Day in Agrabah." But, of course, the main highlights of this game are its many battle themes. They seamlessly combine the intensity of each situation with the high emotional stakes in order to help elevate the unforgettable boss fights. As always, Yoko Shimomura made orchestral rearrangements of all of these songs when Kingdom Hearts 2.5 HD Remix was released in 2014.
